snippet: President Obama’s preparations for an estimated $1 billion effort, including a library and global foundation, are showing the same fierce discipline he displayed in winning office.
abstract: Pres Obama has been making private preparations for his postpresidency, organizing next steps in methodical manner very similar to his execution of 2008 presidential campaign; president, wife Michelle and their top aides are aiming to create presidential library, foundation and endowment estimated to cost as much as $1 billion.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and GARDINER HARRIS

lead_paragraph: President Obama’s preparations for an estimated $1 billion effort, including a library and global foundation, are showing the same fierce discipline he displayed in winning office.

headline.main: With High-Profile Help, Obama Plots Life After Presidency
headline.print_headline: Obama Plots Postpresidency in Campaign Mode
